author: Regan Mertz
title: Survival of the fishiest: Roaring Fork Conservancy releases trout into Roaring Fork River | PostIndependent.com
text: Survival of the fishiest: Roaring Fork Conservancy releases trout into Roaring Fork River Six “Halloween baby” trout were released into the Roaring Fork River on Wednesday. The trout, born on Halloween in 2023, were raised at the Roaring Fork Conservancy for almost a year before they were released into the Roaring Fork River in Basalt. It was survival of the fittest for these six fish, as they were the only ones to survive out of the 200 other eggs they came from. Roaring Fork Conservancy Executive Director Rick Lofaro said that this is normal. Two hundred eggs will usually yield six to 10 fish. “That gives you an idea of nature,” he said. “Trout, and salmon especially, are laying thousands of eggs with a very small percentage of surviving.” Raising the trout from eggs to fingerling size, which is about three to four inches long, is made possible through a partnership program with Colorado Trout Unlimited, known as Trout in the Classroom. For the Trout in the Classroom program, trout are raised by educators and students. The program is sitting at a 30% survival rate for trout right now. For wildlife professionals, the success rate increases to 80%. These professionals have more access to hatchery systems that aid in the higher survival rate of the trout, like a flow-through system. The classrooms typically have a closed-system hatchery. “It’s a little more difficult to raise these finicky, cold-water-loving fishies,” Colorado Trout Unlimited Youth Education Coordinator Natalie Flowers said. Louisville Middle School near Boulder raised 175 out of the 200 trout eggs, which Flowers called a “phenomenal success rate.” When Colorado Trout Unlimited and Roaring Fork Conservancy staff first got out to the Roaring Fork River at around 11:30 a.m., the water measured 50 degrees. Staff were looking for a five-degree difference between the river and what the water the trout were formally living in measured at. The fish were living at around 52 degrees, and although this is within the five-degree difference, staff still “tempered” the fish, or took some of the water from the river and put it in the tub the fish were being kept in. Another reason to temper the fish is for differing pH balances. The difference in pH comes from several factors, including minerals found in the river. If the fish are placed into a new ecosystem, like the Roaring Fork River, and are shocked, whether from temperature or pH balance, it could lessen their chance of survival. The reason humans do not receive this severe of a shock when doing polar plunges or swimming in alpine lakes or enjoying a sauna is because humans are warm-blooded, or endothermic. Possessing this trait allows a human or other wam-blooded animals to regulate temperature and warm or cool them. Cold-blooded, or ectothermic, animals, like fish, do not have this same trait. These animals are affected by their surroundings, so they cannot regulate body temperature. Trout can survive at a range of temperatures, but they are most comfortable at around 52 degrees. Anywhere between 48 to 62 degrees is a range that trout can survive in. Temperatures over 65 degrees is not suitable for trout, but rainbow trout can stand a little bit of a higher temperature. “In many aspects, trout are as fragile as a newborn baby,” Lofaro said. “But in other aspects, they’re tough as a bull.” Staff also caught aquatic macro-invertebrates, or water insects, with nets in the river and by flipping over river rocks. After the trout have spent almost the first year of their lives eating hatchery food, or pellets from Colorado Parks and Wildlife, staff wanted to know what the trout would be taking a liking to once released. These water insects hide under rocks because trout and other predators, like birds, like to eat them. “I suggest also trying them yourself,” Lofaro said. “They’re not quite as good as sushi, but they’re pretty good.” The most common aquatic macro-invertebrates found in Roaring Fork Valley rivers are mayflies, stone flies, and caddisflies. “We have great water quality here in the Roaring Fork Valley, so we always will see a nice, high variety of insects and high diversity, as well as high numbers,” Lofaro said. [See more](https://www.postindependent.com/recent-stories/local/) [See more](https://www.postindependent.com/trending-stories/news/) Support Local Journalism Support Local Journalism Readers around Glenwood Springs and Garfield County make the Post Independent’s work possible. Your financial contribution supports our efforts to deliver quality, locally relevant journalism. Now more than ever, your support is critical to help us keep our community informed about the evolving coronavirus pandemic and the impact it is having locally. Every contribution, however large or small, will make a difference. Each donation will be used exclusively for the development and creation of increased news coverage.

author: SSD
title: New for SHOT Show 2024 – Holosun IRIS
text: Holosun is proud to announce the all-new IRIS. The IRIS (Integrated Rifle Infrared System) is an ultra compact, class IIIr visible green aiming device with a coaxial mounted class 2m IR laser and IR illuminator for use with night vision devices. IRIS features an ergonomic slider to dial in the IR illuminator between flood and spot. A new electronic selector switch toggles between visible, IR pointer, IR illuminator, or IR pointer & illiuminator with LED indicators for current mode. IRIS is powered by a CR123 battery and is activated either from the top-mounted fire button or using the compatible, industry standard remote switch. TECH & FEATURES: – IR Pointer and Illuminator with VCSEL laser – New Compact Housing Design – Quick Adjustable Focus IR Illuminator – Coaxial Laser Mechanism – Intensity Selector Switch – Mode Button w/LED Indicator SPECS: – IPX8 Certified Waterproof – Battery: CR123A – Dimension: 3.2 x 1.97 x 1.34 in – Weight: 6.35 oz – 7075 T6 Aluminum Housing – Travel Range ± 50 MOA – 0.5 MOA Windage and Elevation Adjustment Per Click MSRP: Pricing and availability to be announced at SHOT Show.

author: Williams Anuku
title: ‘Nigeria capable of producing vaccines’ – Tinubu boasts to Gavi executives
text:
President Bola Tinubu has called on Gavi, the Vaccine Alliance, to collaborate with potential Nigerian vaccine manufacturers to ensure equitable access to life-saving vaccines for children and adults.
Speaking at a meeting with a delegation of Gavi, led by its Chief Executive Officer, Dr. Sania Nishtar, at the State House, on Thursday, President Tinubu said partnership on local vaccine production has become necessary owing to the challenges faced by developing countries, especially during the COVID-19 pandemic and other infectious disease outbreaks.
“We have capable and talented people who can make the necessary contributions to the production of vaccines in Nigeria and the rest of Africa,” the President told the visiting CEO, who assumed office on March 18, 2024, and has embarked on visits to some African countries.
The President assured the Gavi CEO of Nigeria’s commitment to fulfilling its outstanding counterpart contributions for routine vaccines for the year 2023.
He directed the Coordinating Minister of Health and Social Welfare, Professor Muhammad Ali Pate, to work with the Coordinating Minister of the Economy and Minister of Finance to ensure the release of necessary funds for vaccine procurement.
”We intend to contribute to the development of our healthcare programme, and we are committed to partnering with Gavi,” the President said.
President Tinubu stated that his administration is focused on ensuring that no child is left behind when it comes to vaccination against preventable childhood diseases.
”Gavi’s commitment to humanity is recognised throughout the world. Thank you for your impactful commitment to humanity, and we welcome your collaboration to save our children from preventable diseases.
”We as a nation are committed to your values, and we believe that no child should be left unprotected,” he said.
President Tinubu acknowledged the invaluable perspective shared by the Gavi CEO, who hails from a developing country, Pakistan, and emphasized the importance of leveraging her experience for the benefit of children’s health.
Commending Dr. Nishtar for her visit to Nigeria and support for the administration’s health-sector initiatives, the President pledged to prioritise investments in health-sector renewal, noting the importance of coordination and collaboration among federal, state, and local governments.

author: David Velazquez Casper Star-Tribune
title: Casper man accused of rape
text: A Casper man is facing sexual assault charges for allegedly smoking meth and then raping a women in his basement. Marcus Dean Grayson, born in 1984, made his preliminary appearance at the Natrona County Circuit Court on Tuesday and is charged with sexual assault in the first degree and sexual assault in the second degree. Following the hearing, Grayson's case was bound over to district court. The first degree penalty is punishable by five years to fifty years in prison. The victim alleges that she was giving Grayson a ride to his home and that he asked her to come inside. Grayson’s wife was not home at the time, according to an affidavit. On the basement’s couch Grayson smoked meth out of a pipe; the alleged victim denied using meth at that time, according to an affidavit. People are also reading… The alleged victim told police that Grayson “forced himself” onto her and that she broke two nails while punching Grayson. The victim “had been wearing light colored, high-waisted jeans with one button and a long zipper,” and a “soft, brown and fuzzy hoodie that was short,” the affidavit states. The affidavit stated that officers observed the victim “did have several broken nails on both of her hands.” After the encounter the victim messaged Grayson saying that he “should listen when I said no the million times I said no,” the affidavit said. A search of the victim’s phone revealed that Grayson apologized profusely after the event through text messages. “I’m freaking out right now like I did something wrong — like terribly wrong,” Grayson messaged, according to the affidavit. “ I just flushed everything I had and I'm getting — out of here to do this. Nobody should have come home to it.” The victim declined to have a sexual assault forensic exam done. Search warrant Police conducted a search warrant on Grayson’s home a week later and conducted an interview with Grayson’s wife — who told police that Grayson told her about the incident after two unknown men showed up at the home. The wife told police that the victim wanted “Grayson to give her meth for the ride and Grayson did not have any. [The victim] got angry and left.” She additionally told officers that Grayson told her that he and the victim were “never intimate and she was trying to get money out of him by accusing him of sexual assault.” Police recovered a marijuana vape pen and a “one hitter” and swabbed the couch in the basement. Interview with Grayson Grayson told police in an interview that the encounter was consensual and that he and the victim flirted while smoking meth together. He additionally told police that the victim “had brought meth with her which was packaged in a small twisted plastic bag.” Grayson told police that following the encounter they smoked more meth together and kissed before she left. Grayson additionally told police that two men showed up at his door and he received text messages asking for money. One message from the victim said something to the effect of “send money to CashApp or this goes public,” and another message from an unknown number describing the incident as messed up and adding that “I need some bread.” A police search through Grayson’s phone found that all messages and calls had been deleted — except for the messages with the victim and his wife. Police also found that all camera footage of Grayson’s home on the day of the footage had been deleted — except for the video of the two guys that showed up at his home. A detective noted that messages on Grayson’s phone to the victim “appeared to be ‘edited.’” David Velazquez is a reporter at the Casper Star-Tribune and can be reached at 307-301-0506, or at [david.velazquez@trib.com](mailto:david.velazquez@trib.com)

author: The Staff The Canadian Press
title: Power restored to most in Atlantic Canada after messy winter storm | Globalnews.ca
text:
Many Atlantic Canadians who were in the dark after this weekend’s messy winter storm have had their power restored as of Sunday afternoon.
The region faced powerful blasts of wind and major tidal surges along the coast Saturday, and at a peak more than 5,000 homes lost power.
Weather alerts issued by Environment Canada for Atlantic Canada have been lifted everywhere except for the western coast of Newfoundland which is under a warning due to strong and potentially damaging winds throughout Sunday afternoon.
Get the latest National news. Sent to your email, every day. As of Sunday at 1 p.m., there are about 700 customers in the dark in the Channel Port-aux-Basques area of Newfoundland due to the extreme weather.
Trending Now Critical emergency alert issued as Alberta’s power grid put under strain ‘Worst Tinder date ever’: Jann Arden asked to clean up own head wound in hospital About 140 people are without power in Nova Scotia, down from 3,500 customers in the dark Sunday morning.
In New Brunswick there are 125 customers without power, and only 10 in the dark in Prince Edward Island.
Story continues below advertisement This report by The Canadian Press was first published Jan. 14, 2024.
More on Canada Canada’s health care crunch has become ‘horrific and inhumane,’ doctors warn Teen dies after falling from chairlift at Quebec ski resort, investigators looking into cause 5-year-old dies after apparent hotel fold-out bed incident, Quebec police say Houthi response to Yemen airstrikes may be ‘limited,’ ex-U.S. envoy says

author: Miguel Patinha Dias
title: Novos 'Assassin's Creed' teve lançamento adiado (outra vez)
text:
A Ubisoft anunciou que decidiu adiar novamente o lançamento de ‘Assassin’s Creed Shadows’, o próximo jogo da popular ‘franchise’ que terá lugar no Japão feudal.
Serve recordar que ‘Assassin’s Creed Shadows’ era suposto ser lançado no final do ano e já teve o lançamento adiado para 14 de fevereiro. No entanto, parece que a editora francesa ainda não está pronta para fazer este jogo chegar às lojas, decidindo adiar novamente para o dia 20 de março.
Em comunicado, a Ubisoft indica que precisa de mais tempo para polir esta experiência mas, como nota a Variety, o motivo pode estar relacionado com a intenção da empresa ser vendida antes que o jogo chegue às lojas.
Assassin’s Creed Shadows now releases March 20, 2025.
— Assassin's Creed (@assassinscreed)[pic.twitter.com/wTPzY0oiHy][January 9, 2025]
Leia Também: [Clássico de jogos de luta está de volta e está mais realista do que nunca](https://www.noticiasaominuto.com/tech/2703194/classico-de-jogos-de-luta-esta-de-volta-e-esta-mais-realista-do-que-nunca)

author: Evelyn Blackwell
title: Friends And Family Mourn The Loss Of Canadians Killed By Hamas In Israel - WorldNewsEra
text: [Canada](../) Friends and family mourn the loss of Canadians killed by Hamas in Israel Friends, family and government officials have confirmed that at least seven Canadians were killed when Hamas militants conducted a series of attacks in Israel on Oct. 7. Global Affairs Canada has said an eighth person who was not a citizen but had deep ties to Canada also died in the ensuing conflict. Another Canadian, who has not been identified, died in Lebanon during the hostilities. The Hamas attacks killed an estimated 1,200 people and militants took another 240 hostage, 105 of whom were released during a temporary pause in the violence at the end of last month. As Israel continues its retaliation on Hamas in the Gaza Strip, authorities there say more than 20,000 Palestinians have now been killed. Here’s what we know about the Hamas victims with ties to Canada: Judih Weinstein Haggai Judih Weinstein Haggai, 70, was out on an early-morning walk when Hamas started its attack, her family says. She told members of her Nir Oz kibbutz that a militant on a motorcycle shot her husband and she was less severely wounded. The community was unable to dispatch an ambulance before militants arrived there. Last week, the kibbutz confirmed Gadi Haggai, Judih’s husband, died on Oct. 7, and on Thursday they confirmed Weinstein Haggai also died that day, and her body is being held in Gaza. Weinstein Haggai was born in New York state but arrived in Toronto at the age of three, and moved to Israel 20 years later to live with her husband. She held Canadian, Israeli and American citizenships. Weinstein Haggai was an artist and a volunteer who the kibbutz said “pursued many initiatives to advance peace in the region.” Her brother Larry Weinstein said the family is distressed by Israel’s offensive in Gaza and the rise of hateful speech in Canada toward both Jews and Muslims. “We’re inspired by my sister, who believed in peace and believed in harmony,” he said. “There can’t be any kind of resolution when people are at each other’s throats.” Vivian Silver Vivian Silver, 74, was in her home on Kibbutz Be’eri near the Gaza border and talking on the phone with her son Yonatan Zeigen when they learned of the incursion by Hamas into Israel. “We couldn’t grasp the incapability of the Israeli army to defend the civilians … we started to say goodbye because we realized this is probably our last words to each other,” Zeigen later told a news conference organized by the Jerusalem Press Club. He said they shifted their conversations to text messages so his mother could stay silent, and someone broke into her home. They said they loved one another before the messages stopped coming. Zeigen said he had received information that she was taken hostage, and her phone had been geolocated in Gaza. On Monday, his brother Chen Zeigen confirmed their mother’s death. He said Israeli authorities told him the remains found earlier in the kibbutz had been identified as Silver. He said his mother was born in Winnipeg and moved to Israel in 1974. She dedicated her life to peacebuilding and fostering understanding between Israelis and Palestinians, he added. She also volunteered to help children in Gaza access medical care in Israel. Tiferet Lapidot Tiferet Lapidot, 22, was a few days shy of her 23rd birthday and attending a music festival when the Hamas attack began. Her cousin Oran Zlotnik remembered Lapidot as a charismatic and compassionate person who had travelled the world, taught in Africa and spent time in Australia before she returned to Israel in the fall. Her uncle Harel Lapidot said she called her mother the morning of the attack to say she was hiding in a bush and to ask whether she should flee. Her cellphone was later tracked to the Gaza Strip, leading family to believe she was being held hostage. They then mounted a campaign to secure her freedom. Zlotnik said that when the cellphone of one of Lapidot’s friends, confirmed deceased, was also traced to Gaza, the family realized it was possible she wasn’t a hostage. Harel Lapidot said his niece’s body was later identified and the family held a funeral. “We know for a fact they were hunted,” he said. “They ran away and they were hunted and killed.” Tiferet Lapidot was an Israeli citizen but her family was from Canada, including her father, Ohad, who was born in Saskatchewan. Harel Lapidot thanked the Jewish community in Canada and MPs who had reached out to help and offer support. The family had a meeting with Foreign Affairs Minister Mélanie Joly while she was in Israel. Netta Epstein Israeli-Canadian Netta Epstein, 21, died when his home, Kibbutz Kfar Aza, came under attack. His mother, Ayelet Shachar-Epstein, said he loved life. She learned the circumstances of his death from text messages he sent her in the moments before he was killed, and from his fiancée, Irene Shavit, who survived. Netta Epstein was inside a safe room with Shavit, and he jumped on a grenade thrown in by the attackers. Shachar-Epstein, who also lost her mother-in-law and two brothers-in-law in the attacks, described it as a terrorist invasion. She said her son, who had worked with special needs youth, had returned home two months earlier after completing military service. He was born in Montreal and was a Canadian citizen. Shachar-Epstein said many members of the family still live in that city. Shir Georgy Israeli Canadian Shir Georgy, 22, was killed by Hamas militants who ambushed the music festival near Kibbutz Re’im. Georgy’s aunt Michal Bouganim confirmed the death. “We are currently a mess, heartbroken,” Bouganim said in a Facebook message. Bouganim shared a 22-second clip on her social media in which a terrified Georgy was seen sitting on a floor, with her back against a wall and surrounded by other festival attendees — some of them injured. Georgy’s funeral was held in Israel. Adi Vital-Kaploun Adi Vital-Kaploun, 33, was killed by Hamas militants in her kibbutz near the Israeli border with the Gaza Strip, said the Jewish Federation of Ottawa. The group’s CEO made a statement on behalf of Vital-Kaploun’s family, saying the dual citizen has a large extended family in the Ottawa area. The family said she died a hero, after convincing her killers to spare her two young children and warning her father and husband to stay hidden during the attack. “Adi was a beautiful woman that brought love and lightness to the people around her, but also she was very focused and determined to make a beautiful life for her family,” her cousin-in-law Aaron Smith said in an interview. The family said she was an amazing mother and wife, always bringing love and laughter to their household. She was also a talented dancer, saxophonist and basketball player. After completing her master’s degree in engineering, Vital-Kaploun excelled in her cybersecurity career, they said. “We are mourning trying to process this unconscionable act of terrorism in her kibbutz and across the country,” said the family, adding that they wish her memory to be “a blessing.” Ben Mizrachi Canadian Ben Mizrachi was one of at least 260 people gunned down by Hamas militants at the music festival in southern Israel. Mizrachi, 22, from Vancouver, was described as “larger than life with a big personality” in a statement by his former high school in B.C. Ezra Shanken, CEO of the Jewish Federation of Greater Vancouver, said Mizrachi was about to start university in Israel after serving with the country’s national defence force. Hilit Nurick, a home economics teacher at King David High School in Vancouver, remembered Mizrachi as a “kind, wonderful, and community-minded” young man who had a positive influence on everyone around him. Nurick said she and Mizrachi once put a large event together for more than 100 people at school. “He was in charge of making Moroccan-style spicy fish stew. He brought his mother’s recipe and shared it with everyone and taught us how to make it,” said Nurick. “He was incredible, just an incredible human being.” Alexandre Look Alexandre Look, who had recently celebrated his 33rd birthday, was among those killed while attending the musical festival. Look, who lived in Montreal with his family before moving to Mexico, died a hero, his dad said in a Facebook post. “Like a true warrior he left as a hero wanting to protect the people he was with,” Alain Haim Look said. Friend Lior Horovitz described him as a “once-in-a-lifetime person” who became like family during their five-year friendship. In a phone interview from a town outside Tel Aviv, she said she and her boyfriend met Alexandre Look in Mexico. They became fast friends and would organize their vacations to meet up, either in Mexico or Israel. He was a proud Jewish Canadian and a generous person who would do anything for his friends, she said. “He’s a person who loves people,” she said. “He’s the guy that’s always going to help others, especially if they are Jewish.” [World News](/)|| [Latest News](/news)|| [U.S. News](../../us-news) [Source link](//www.ctvnews.ca/canada/friends-and-family-mourn-the-loss-of-canadians-killed-by-hamas-in-israel-1.6703766)

author: Vlad
title: Samsung One UI 7's first beta is reported buggier than usual
text: Samsung has been working on [One UI 7](samsung_one_ui_7_based_on_android_15_is_only_arriving_next_year-news-64787.php) based on Android 15 for a long while, and the release of the first beta has seen [many delays](samsung_users_facing_further_one_ui_7_delays-news-65172.php), in a rumored effort by the company to [improve its skin significantly](one_ui_7_design_changes_showcased_online-news-65094.php). Major improvements do however mean major changes, and those never come without many nasty bugs. According to the prolific tipster Ice Universe, that's exactly what you should expect from the first One UI 7 beta, whenever it does finally arrive. One UI 7 Beta may not be launched smoothly, and there are too many bugs. Even in the latest version of XKB, there are still bugs in animation, and they are new bugs. — ICE UNIVERSE (@UniverseIce) There are too many things that Samsung has fallen behind in recent years. It is very difficult for them to make up…[November 15, 2024] Of course, it being a beta, you would naturally expect some issues to occur - otherwise it would go straight to a stable release. But Ice Universe claims that this will be a pretty rough beta, with many animation-related bugs, including new ones that have been introduced in the latest [internal test builds](first_one_ui_7_beta_build_spotted_on_samsungs_test_servers-news-65288.php). That also makes sense since animations are a big focus for what's changing in One UI 7 (thankfully, we might add). While Ice Universe mentions Samsung has "fallen behind" in a lot of ways, software-wise, in recent years, he is optimistic about the Korean company's ability to fix all of the problems in the near future. And it all starts with the One UI 7 release, which may arrive, in its first public beta form, [as early as next week](samsung_to_bring_one_ui_7_beta_next_week-news-65266.php).

author: Alfie Stratton
title: What’s The Reason? Double Glazed Window Repair Is Everywhere This Year
text:
window repairs near me – Posteezy.com ,
Window replacement and repair can give your home a new look, and also improve its performance. This will help keep your home quiet free of noise and save on energy bills.
Choosing a trustworthy glazier or window company will ensure that you get the highest quality products, which have modern technologies such as low-emissivity glass and window films. Make use of our Find a Pro feature to search for Bellmore, NY Windows & Double Glazing experts.
Window Replacement
Window replacements are an excellent way of improving energy efficiency while also reducing noise and enhancing security. It is important to speak with a reputable supplier or service provider to ensure that the new units are of high quality, correctly sized, and installed correctly. This will help you maximize your investment and allow you to get the best results. In addition, replacement windows can be an excellent option for homes with old single pane windows that fail to effectively block UV radiation.
Replacing your window glass is a cost-effective method to improve the efficiency and insulation of your home. New uPVC and wooden frames offer an excellent insulation against wind, cold, and rain, while double glazed window repairs near me -glazed windows with low-emissivity (low-e) coatings and argon gas fillings reduce heat transfer, resulting in lower energy costs. The most efficient double-paned windows are also acoustically insulated, and have multi-point locking mechanisms for enhanced security.
Replacement of a single pane within double-glazed windows can cost between PS55 and PS145, depending on its size and. It is generally cheaper to repair a broken window. However, you should always consult a professional before deciding if you should replace your windows or not.
If your double-glazed windows appear discolored it could be an indication of a leak or problem with the seal. A specific repair procedure can be utilized to eliminate the moisture and then clean the glass unit and install the spacer bar again and a desiccant in order to prevent further condensation. This repair process can be carried out at home or on the spot and is typically more affordable than replacing the entire window.
It is more cost-effective to replace a double pane that’s been damaged, but not always the glass. Double-pane windows have a gap between the two glass panes, which is sealed with argon or Krypton gas to create an airtight seal. This reduces energy loss. If a single pane is broken the window, it’s generally required to replace the entire window to preserve energy efficiency and ensure an intact airtight seal.
Misted Double Glazing
Double glazing that has been contaminated can pose a threat to homeowners. It can alter the way your windows work and cause dampness and mold. It is crucial to fix any double glazing issues as soon as you can especially when winter is approaching.
If the glass of your windows is prone to condensation between the panes, it is referred to as misting. This usually happens due to poor installation or air infiltration. It is recommended to use a FENSA-regulated window installer to avoid this.
It’s also essential to keep your double glazing free of dirt, dust and debris. The frames can be cleaned using warm soapy water. However, if the frames are made from wood or aluminium, you might need to explore other methods of cleaning them thoroughly.
One of the most common problems that double glazing owners face post-installation is that their windows or doors become difficult to open or close. This may be caused by extreme temperatures as the frame expands or shrinks depending on the weather. It’s worth trying to warm up or cool down the frame with hot or cold water and adjusting any handles, hinges or mechanisms. If this doesn’t help you, you might want to contact the company that installed your double glazing. They might provide a repair or refund.
If you notice that windows with double glazing are misting, this could be due to the seal between the two panes has failed. This can be due to a variety of factors, including poor installation, age or harsh chemicals or cleaners that contain oil. It is also recommended to use an installer who is FENSA-regulated to make sure that your double-glazing complies completely with UK building regulations.
In some cases, you can repair the double-glazing unit that is misted by replacing the bars that hold the spacers with ones that are a little warmer. This will increase the temperature of the glass and assist to stop condensation. You can also opt for thermally efficient glasses with coatings that emit low emissions, and argon between the glass to prevent condensation.
Window Repair
Double-pane windows work well to protect your home from the elements, and can also improve the efficiency of your HVAC system. Your windows will eventually develop issues, so it is important to know when you should replace or repair them.
If you notice an increase in moisture, fogging or dirt it could be an indication that your window’s seal has failed. The seals stop air from escaping between the two glass panes in your IGU. (IGU).
This could result in your window being less efficient and resulting in higher energy bills. Depending on how serious the issue is, you may need to replace the entire window or just the glass.
In some cases a professional may be able to perform an effective window repair in order to fix the problem. This could involve cleaning the area and repairing the seal, or it could just require a small amount of silicone or putty to fix the gap. This will stop the seal from splintering and will allow you to utilize your window as normal.
Window repairs are typically more affordable than window replacements however, it is crucial to weigh your options before deciding if you want to repair or replace your windows. You’ll have to take into consideration the condition of your existing frame, the cost of the repairs and whether you want a new look or better insulation from the outdoors.
You can improve your windows by installing new components such as handles, hinges or sash cords. These upgrades will not only make windows easier to operate, but also ensure that they are safe and secure. The screens of your windows can also be damaged or ripped, allowing insects to enter your home. Replacing them will keep your home insect-free and create clean, healthier surroundings.
The window frame is a crucial component of the overall structure of the window, since it holds the glass panels in position. The frames can be made out of aluminum, wood or vinyl and can become cracked, rotted or damaged from weather or sunlight exposure. Window moldings can also get damaged and require to be replaced or repaired. Generally, wooden frames are more expensive to repair and replace than vinyl or aluminum and the price will vary depending on the type of material and degree of damage.
Skylight Repair
Skylights are a great method to let natural light into your home without creating a bright. Skylights are also a great way to increase insulation and cut down on heating costs. Like all windows and doors, they are susceptible to a range of issues. It is important to get a professional’s attention immediately if the double-pane skylight has been damaged. This will prevent condensation, water leaks, and other damage to the frame and glass.
Skylight leaks usually occur when the glazing seal and flashing loosen or when the frame begins to corrode. These problems can result in leaking water through the frame and into the ceiling. A contractor can fix a leaking rooflight by sealing or replacing the flashing, seal and frame. The cost to repair a skylight varies depending on the size of the window and the type of glass. If the frame is severely damaged, it might be worth replacing it.
Mold is another common problem with skylights. It can appear on the outside of the windows, in the frame, or on the inside of the glass. It could be caused by condensation, leaky pipes or an insufficient seal. If the mold is contained to the surrounding area of the window, minor repairs can be made. If the mold is extensive, the skylight may need to be replaced.
It is recommended to stay clear of trying DIY repairs by yourself if aren’t sure what to do. If you’re not familiar with woodworking or construction it may be better to seek out a professional to repair or replace your window. A professional can also be able recommend other options for home improvement which could save you money in the end. They might also provide an assurance for the work they perform, so you can be confident that your investment is protected. It’s recommended to request an estimate from a few different companies to compare costs. You’ll be able to find the best price for your needs and budget.

author: Ameryᱹ
title: IN MY LIFE - an original story | Quotev
text: He had served countless kings, faked many deaths, and bided his time, waiting to find someone worthy of him. Waiting to find someone who wouldn’t use him for his strength, he wanted someone who would appreciate every little kind thing he did. He wished for someone that would voice their opinions, and be respectful and gentle. All the ones that tried to woo him failed, they flirted and gave the simplest gift with little to no meaning. They wore revealing garments in an attempt to make him aroused. But he wasn’t. He was disgusted. He saw what they wanted from him. They wanted power, they wanted fame. They were greedy little monsters. Likewise, they would touch him on his chest, giggle with him, hold his hand and for what? He may have lived with the richest of the richest kings, but no amount of money would suffice for them, they would always want more and more and more. Until they died, and he didn’t. He watched their wrinkly faces relax as they took their last breaths. Some even added his name to their will, they transferred jewellery and articles of clothing. Kindly, he kept them all in a nook, being careful not to shatter or damage any of the gifts. Some of the eager lovers even offered him their children at their time of death, in hopes that one day, his blood could run through their descendants. It was sad. Seeing hopefuls come and go, only wanting him for what he was and not for who he was. It hurt. But he believed in love. He believed that he could and would find someone. He trusted that this world would let him find someone. The world could not be that cruel to him, he has been kind and grateful towards all who were found in his presence. He’d seen people love each other, it was indeed possible. He had seen people caring for each other as if their love was as immortal as he was. He witnessed old lovers dying on a porch, young lovers having their first kiss on a starry night, and young adults getting married while having the brightest of smiles on their faces. But why couldn’t someone love him? He prayed to the gods that someone would love him. That was all he wanted. Love. What a word it was. It brought hurt and tears as much as it brought smiles and laughter. Love could be a poisonous thing, deadly. It could be a lovely thing. It could be stronger than anything in the world, having enough strength to break down the tallest and biggest of walls, it could also be fragile and meek, barely holding on to its support. Love was a funny feeling. It messed with you, laughed and giggled as you sobbed because of it. It was a shadow, following you, making you feel things you didn’t know you could feel. Love pained and wounded people. Love made people ecstatic. He wanted it all, the full package. He wanted to feel love. Oh, dearest world, let me find someone, he begged every night. His shining hazel eyes glistened with tears when he looked up at the fortunate stars. I would rather end my everlasting life than be without a lover. That was all he wanted. Love.
